svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
May 25, 2024" date: "2024-05-25"
Eth News and Links
All core devs
* All core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) #188 call video .Â Notes from Tim Beiko and
Christine Kim : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade : Discussion on when/what to ship :
EF testing team upgrade options , prefer splitting Pectra into two upgrades Reth
propose shipping a big upgrade in Q1 2025 with PeerDAS & EOF Including EOF delays
Pectra by ~3 months, support from some EL teams & Solidity EOF benchmarks show some
reductions in code size & gas PeerDAS & blob size increase priorities to be discussed
by CL teams at ACDC, then finalize Pectra scope at next ACDE EIP7702 replaces EIP3074,
CFId, add to next devnet, breakout room needed to finalize spec (optional nonce &
chain ID) before including in Pectra Execution API proposal to optionally include
return data in transaction receipts Minimum priority fee: Geth defaults to 1 gwei,
evaluate lowering, no need to standardize Using Portal networkâ€™s history network for
history expiry
All core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) #188 call video .Â Notes from Tim Beiko and Christine
Kim :
* Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade : Discussion on when/what to ship : EF testing
team upgrade options , prefer splitting Pectra into two upgrades Reth propose shipping
a big upgrade in Q1 2025 with PeerDAS & EOF Including EOF delays Pectra by ~3 months,
support from some EL teams & Solidity EOF benchmarks show some reductions in code size
& gas PeerDAS & blob size increase priorities to be discussed by CL teams at ACDC,
then finalize Pectra scope at next ACDE EIP7702 replaces EIP3074, CFId, add to next
devnet, breakout room needed to finalize spec (optional nonce & chain ID) before
including in Pectra
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade :
* Discussion on when/what to ship : EF testing team upgrade options , prefer splitting
Pectra into two upgrades Reth propose shipping a big upgrade in Q1 2025 with PeerDAS &
EOF Including EOF delays Pectra by ~3 months, support from some EL teams & Solidity
EOF benchmarks show some reductions in code size & gas PeerDAS & blob size increase
priorities to be discussed by CL teams at ACDC, then finalize Pectra scope at next
ACDE
Discussion on when/what to ship :
* EF testing team upgrade options , prefer splitting Pectra into two upgrades
EF testing team upgrade options , prefer splitting Pectra into two upgrades
* Reth propose shipping a big upgrade in Q1 2025 with PeerDAS & EOF
Reth propose shipping a big upgrade in Q1 2025 with PeerDAS & EOF
* Including EOF delays Pectra by ~3 months, support from some EL teams & Solidity EOF
benchmarks show some reductions in code size & gas
Including EOF delays Pectra by ~3 months, support from some EL teams & Solidity
* EOF benchmarks show some reductions in code size & gas
* PeerDAS & blob size increase priorities to be discussed by CL teams at ACDC, then
finalize Pectra scope at next ACDE
PeerDAS & blob size increase priorities to be discussed by CL teams at ACDC, then
* EIP7702 replaces EIP3074, CFId, add to next devnet, breakout room needed to finalize
spec (optional nonce & chain ID) before including in Pectra
EIP7702 replaces EIP3074, CFId, add to next devnet, breakout room needed to finalize
* Execution API proposal to optionally include return data in transaction receipts
Execution API proposal to optionally include return data in transaction receipts
* Minimum priority fee: Geth defaults to 1 gwei, evaluate lowering, no need to
standardize
Minimum priority fee: Geth defaults to 1 gwei, evaluate lowering, no need to
* Using Portal networkâ€™s history network for history expiry
Using Portal networkâ€™s history network for history expiry
* Client team interop (Kenya) focused on Pectra, PeerDAS & Verkle: Pectra-devnet-0 &
peerdas-devnet-0 launched EOF breakout : discussion on whether to include in Pectra &
spec updates PeerDAS : design simplifications History expiry plan
Client team interop (Kenya) focused on Pectra, PeerDAS & Verkle:
* Pectra-devnet-0 & peerdas-devnet-0 launched
Pectra-devnet-0 & peerdas-devnet-0 launched
* EOF breakout : discussion on whether to include in Pectra & spec updates
EOF breakout : discussion on whether to include in Pectra & spec updates
* PeerDAS : design simplifications
PeerDAS : design simplifications
* History expiry plan
History expiry plan
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.5% still too close to 33.3% threshold Lido node operator (Numic)
breach of dev machine with encrypted key backups
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.5% still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Lido node operator (Numic)
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 37% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Layer 1
* Data Always: min-bid setting effectiveness
Research
* Anonymous Inclusion Lists (anon-ILs) : distributed mechanism for anonymizing IL
proposers
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Nimbus v24.5.1 : beacon & builder API improvements and fixes
v24.5.0 compatibility issue with certain hardware
* Nimbus v24.5.1 : beacon & builder API improvements and fixes v24.5.0 compatibility
issue with certain hardware
Layer 2
* Vitalik: Layer 2s vs execution sharding
Vitalik: Layer 2s vs execution sharding
* L2BEAT proposed data availability risk framework
L2BEAT proposed data availability risk framework
* Taiko airdrop, eligible GitHub contributors need to bind an address
Taiko airdrop, eligible GitHub contributors need to bind an address
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP7709 : Read BLOCKHASH from storage and update cost EIP7713 : Box types for
EIP712 messages
EIPs:
* EIP7709 : Read BLOCKHASH from storage and update cost
EIP7709 : Read BLOCKHASH from storage and update cost
* EIP7713 : Box types for EIP712 messages
EIP7713 : Box types for EIP712 messages
* RIPs (Rollup Improvement Proposals): RIP7711 : RIP7560 transactions bundle
transaction type RIP7712 : Enable RIP7560 transactions using a two-dimensional nonce
RIPs (Rollup Improvement Proposals):
* RIP7711 : RIP7560 transactions bundle transaction type
RIP7711 : RIP7560 transactions bundle transaction type
* RIP7712 : Enable RIP7560 transactions using a two-dimensional nonce
RIP7712 : Enable RIP7560 transactions using a two-dimensional nonce
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7710 : Contract delegation interfaces ERC7714 : Simple
permissions checks ERC7715 : Request permissions from wallets
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7710 : Contract delegation interfaces
ERC7710 : Contract delegation interfaces
* ERC7714 : Simple permissions checks
ERC7714 : Simple permissions checks
* ERC7715 : Request permissions from wallets
ERC7715 : Request permissions from wallets
Stuff for developers
* Solidity v0.8.26 : require with custom errors (via-IR only), Yul optimizer improved
default sequence and JSON output format slightly changed
Solidity v0.8.26 : require with custom errors (via-IR only), Yul optimizer improved
* Remix v0.49 : RemixAI improvements & TOML syntax highlighting
Remix v0.49 : RemixAI improvements & TOML syntax highlighting
* Foundry: Reusable workflows for GitHub Actions Merkle Multiproof (Solidity):
generate inputs for OpenZeppelin MerkleProof library for fuzz testing Kontrol (formal
verification) adds support for native Foundry cheatcode assertions
Foundry:
* Reusable workflows for GitHub Actions
Reusable workflows for GitHub Actions
* Merkle Multiproof (Solidity): generate inputs for OpenZeppelin MerkleProof library
for fuzz testing
Merkle Multiproof (Solidity): generate inputs for OpenZeppelin MerkleProof library for
fuzz testing
* Kontrol (formal verification) adds support for native Foundry cheatcode assertions
Kontrol (formal verification) adds support for native Foundry cheatcode assertions
* Snekmate (Vyper): adds Halmos symbolic tests for ERC20/721/1155 & math contracts
Snekmate (Vyper): adds Halmos symbolic tests for ERC20/721/1155 & math contracts
* Ape-AWS : Ape plugin to use AWS Key Management Service & IAM access
Ape-AWS : Ape plugin to use AWS Key Management Service & IAM access
* Viem adds EIP4361 Sign-In with Ethereum support
Viem adds EIP4361 Sign-In with Ethereum support
* EVM Diff : adds all chain comparison table to existing side by side compare
EVM Diff : adds all chain comparison table to existing side by side compare
* micro-eth-signer v0.9 : fetch account history & token balances from archive node,
SSZ in 900 lines
micro-eth-signer v0.9 : fetch account history & token balances from archive node, SSZ
in 900 lines
* Vacp2p stealth-address-kit v0.1: derived from ERC5564, Rust & C bindings
Vacp2p stealth-address-kit v0.1: derived from ERC5564, Rust & C bindings
Security
* Gala Games $22M exploit via mint using admin access
Gala Games $22M exploit via mint using admin access
* SEAL wargame with Base & Optimism : simulated vulnerability in bridge withdrawals
SEAL wargame with Base & Optimism : simulated vulnerability in bridge withdrawals
Ecosystem
* EF working on formal policy for potential conflicts of interest Justin Drake &
Dankrad Feist advising EigenFoundation
EF working on formal policy for potential conflicts of interest
* Justin Drake & Dankrad Feist advising EigenFoundation
* Devcon tickets go live in June
Devcon tickets go live in June
Job Listings
* ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering , DevRel - Sygma and more jobs
ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering , DevRel - Sygma and more jobs
* Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer
Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer
* stakefish : DevOps Engineer & Full-stack Engineer
stakefish : DevOps Engineer & Full-stack Engineer
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 1.9 to 111.5 gwei, with 9.1 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 23.3 gwei 11k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 1.9 to 111.5 gwei, with 9.1 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 23.3 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 23.3 gwei
* 11k ETH net issuance this week
11k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $3,063 - $3,913, currently $3,723
ETHUSD : $3,063 - $3,913, currently $3,723
* ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Optimism Retro Funding round 4: 10M OP for Superchain deployers
Optimism Retro Funding round 4: 10M OP for Superchain deployers
* Yuga Labs to no longer touch Punks after Super Punk World backlash
Yuga Labs to no longer touch Punks after Super Punk World backlash
Regulation/business/tokens
* SEC approved eight spot ETH ETF proposals , they go live when S-1 approval occurs
SEC approved eight spot ETH ETF proposals , they go live when S-1 approval occurs
* US House passed FIT21 bill , would give CFTC jurisdiction over digital commodities
Itâ€™s a bad bill yet still a big victory
US House passed FIT21 bill , would give CFTC jurisdiction over digital commodities
* Itâ€™s a bad bill yet still a big victory
* Genesis $2B settlement with New York Attorney General
Genesis $2B settlement with New York Attorney General
General
* Time-based cryptography from weaker assumptions : randomness beacons & delay
functions
Time-based cryptography from weaker assumptions : randomness beacons & delay functions
* Kabosu (the Doge) passed away
Kabosu (the Doge) passed away
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-may-25-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* May 26 â€“ Ethereum Protocol Fellowship cohort 5 application deadline
May 26 â€“ Ethereum Protocol Fellowship cohort 5 application deadline
* May 31-Jun 2 â€“ ETHDublin hackathon & conference
May 31-Jun 2 â€“ ETHDublin hackathon & conference
* May 31-Jun 2 â€“ ETHPrague conference & hackathon
May 31-Jun 2 â€“ ETHPrague conference & hackathon

May 31-Jun 5 â€“ ETH Belgrade hackathon & conference
* Jun 14 â€“ EF EIP4844 data challenge deadline
Jun 14 â€“ EF EIP4844 data challenge deadline
* Jun 21-23 â€“ ETHKyiv hackathon & conference

Aug 2-4 â€“ Ethereum Argentina

Aug 23-26 â€“ ETHTokyo hackathon & conference

Aug 29-31 â€“ ETHAccra hackathon

* Sep 20-22 â€“ ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon

* Oct 4-6 â€“ Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
Oct 4-6 â€“ Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
